entry.summary:

“Yes, understood…”

The doctor’s diagnosis did not come as surprise to Fuyuka. She went to the pharmacy adjacent to the hospital, handed in her prescription, and received the medicine.

“Please get well soon—.”
“… Thank you very much.”

entry.title:
Section 24. Of course I can Catch a Cold.
After all, I’m Only Human.

entry.summary:
Fuyuka has caught a cold. It was a perfect cold. So it was solid, so well-timed, that could only be called perfect.

“Um-umgh…”

entry.title: Section 23. Summer Routines.
entry.summary:
Every morning Fuyuka was leaving the house with heavy step. Despite that it is the city, and the area over here—in residential district—is artificial, the nature is also yet here, so the song of cicadas was buzzing in the air.

entry.title: Section 22. Ohana’s Everyday (Part 2).
entry.summary:
Beep-beep-beep-beep, the alarm clock rang out across the room. The sound, although not particularly loud one, is a high-pitched, and Ohana’s ears jerked to it.

“Nm-umm…”

Rising herself heavily, she confirmed the time. It was precisely five in the afternoon, as planned, and now the time has come when she supposed to begin preparation of a simple dishes.

entry.title: Section 18. The Rubbing Right.
entry.summary:
Sunday. Fuyuka, who had to stay reliant on meal, in conclusion called today a day of rest.
Specifically, a day of mere lounging about at home.

“Say—.”
“Yes?”

It was past one o’clock on a quiet afternoon, a relaxing hour after having lunch. In the midst of it it was when Fuyuka spoke to the girl.

entry.title: Section 14. The Difference in Common Sense.

entry.summary:
Before anything else, Fuyuka intended to ensure her companion with clothes.

According to Ohana, these traditional Japanese garments are the articles formed against some sort of spiritual energy. “So you say, but it’s like being naked, eh,” Fuyuka concluded: Supposing something goes wrong and the energy runs out…
